intro: Heteranthera reniformis var. multiflora, commonly known as the broadleaf water hyssop, is a herbaceous aquatic plant native to the southeastern United States. It features opposite, ovate to lance-shaped leaves that are typically 2–6 inches long and have a waxy surface. The plant produces small, white to pale blue flowers in dense clusters, which bloom from summer to fall. Its roots are fibrous and adapted for anchoring in muddy or aquatic environments. It is often found in marshes, ponds, and slow-moving waterways.
